column1: It was characteristic of Tom Slade that he liked to go off alone occasionally for a ramble in the woods. It was not that he liked the scouts less
column2: but rather that he liked the woods more. It was his wont to stroll off when his camp duties for the day were over and poke around in the adjacent woods.The scouts knew and respected his peculiarities and preferences
column3: particularly those who were regular summer visitors at the big camp
column4: and few ever followed him into his chosen haunts. Occasionally some new scout
column5: tempted by the pervading reputation and unique negligee of Uncle Jeb's young assistant
column6: ventured to follow him and avail himself of the tips and woods lore with which the more experienced scout's conversation abounded when he was in a talking mood. But Tom was a sort of creature apart and the boys of camp
column8: did not intrude upon his lonely rambles.
